pullrequest.title: Plugin to initialize joint controller parameters

content.raw: Good catch. I keep forgetting about scoped model names. Fixed in [c4119d1](https://bitbucket.org/pchorak/gazebo/commits/c4119d1). I tested a nested model and it worked with but not without the scoped name here.
content.html: Good catch. I keep forgetting about scoped model names. Fixed in c4119d1. I tested a nested model and it worked with but not without the scoped name here.

pullrequest.title: Plugin to initialize joint controller parameters

content.raw:
Sorry, one more thing just occurred to me. We can ensure that the plugin is built when the integration test is built with the following:

~~~
diff -r 1054201b80f7 test/integration/CMakeLists.txt
--- a/test/integration/CMakeLists.txt	Fri Aug 18 17:53:02 2017 +0000
+++ b/test/integration/CMakeLists.txt	Tue Aug 22 18:02:02 2017 -0700
@@ -143,6 +143,7 @@
 endif()
 
 # Add plugin dependency
+add_dependencies(${TEST_TYPE}_joint_control_plugin JointControlPlugin)
 add_dependencies(${TEST_TYPE}_joint_test SpringTestPlugin)
 
 set(display_tests
~~~
content.html:
Sorry, one more thing just occurred to me. We can ensure that the plugin is built when the integration test is built with the following:

diff -r 1054201b80f7 test/integration/CMakeLists.txt
--- a/test/integration/CMakeLists.txt   Fri Aug 18 17:53:02 2017 +0000
+++ b/test/integration/CMakeLists.txt   Tue Aug 22 18:02:02 2017 -0700
@@ -143,6 +143,7 @@
 endif()

 # Add plugin dependency
+add_dependencies(${TEST_TYPE}_joint_control_plugin JointControlPlugin)
 add_dependencies(${TEST_TYPE}_joint_test SpringTestPlugin)

 set(display_tests

content.raw: We're trying to move away from boost, do you think [std::regex_replace](http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/regex/regex_replace) could do the trick here?

pullrequest.title: Plugin to initialize joint controller parameters

content.raw:
here's an old thread about `std::regex_replace`; there was a gcc problem at one time, but that may be resolved by now

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/haptix-comm/pull-requests/34/remove-boost-dependency/diff#comment-4943974

we added a custom replace function in sdformat:

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/314/remove-boost-from-parsercc-pr-4-5/diff#chg-src/parser.cc
content.html:
here's an old thread about std::regex_replace; there was a gcc problem at one time, but that may be resolved by now

  • https://bitbucket.org/osrf/haptix-comm/pull-requests/34/remove-boost-dependency/diff#comment-4943974

we added a custom replace function in sdformat:

  • https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/314/remove-boost-from-parsercc-pr-4-5/diff#chg-src/parser.cc

pullrequest.title: Plugin to initialize joint controller parameters

content.raw:
How would be best to specify units? I see some comments that are unit agnostic
([JointController.hh](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/3fef8210ade3cafff215dec49f0820ac1914c2ab/gazebo/physics/JointController.hh?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#JointController.hh-157))
and others that use S.I. units
([Joint.hh](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/3fef8210ade3cafff215dec49f0820ac1914c2ab/gazebo/physics/Joint.hh?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#Joint.hh-326)).
I used generic units in [d777d09](https://bitbucket.org/pchorak/gazebo/commits/d777d090a629e0e110d8167c03ce48887ae3ff42?at=default)
content.html: How would be best to specify units? I see some comments that are unit agnostic (JointController.hh) and others that use S.I. units (Joint.hh). I used generic units in d777d09

pullrequest.title: Plugin to initialize joint controller parameters

content.raw:
Style nitpicks: 

* indent the `return` line
* `std::string const& name` -> `std::string const &_name`

And I think it would be ok to just capture `[&exp]`
content.html:
Style nitpicks:

  • indent the return line
  • std::string const& name -> std::string const &_name

And I think it would be ok to just capture [&exp]
